Class GraphRenderer

java.lang.Object
com.graphs.GraphRenderer
public class GraphRenderer extends Object
The GraphRenderer class is responsible for rendering graphs based on an adjacency matrix. It supports different types of graph generation including single-cycle, cycle-free, and multiple-cycles. The graph is drawn on a provided JavaFX Canvas and uses a TextArea for displaying error messages.

  • Constructor Details

    • GraphRenderer

      public GraphRenderer(javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas canvas)
      Constructs a GraphRenderer instance.
      Parameters:
      canvas - The canvas on which the graph will be drawn.

  • Method Details

    • generateGraph

      public void generateGraph(int nodeCountInput, int cycleCountInput)
      Generates a graph based on the provided number of nodes and cycles. The graph is drawn after generation.
      Parameters:
      nodeCountInput - The number of nodes in the graph.
      cycleCountInput - The number of cycles in the graph.

    • drawGraph

      public void drawGraph(int nodeCount, double scale, double translateX, double translateY)
      Draws the graph on the canvas based on the adjacency matrix.
      Parameters:
      nodeCount - The number of nodes in the graph.
      scale - The scaling factor for the graph.
      translateX - The translation offset in the X direction.
      translateY - The translation offset in the Y direction.

    • handleNodeClick

      public void handleNodeClick(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event, int nodeCount, double translateX, double translateY, double scale)
      Handles mouse click events on the canvas. If the click is on a node, it toggles the highlight for that node.
      Parameters:
      event - The MouseEvent triggered by the click.
      nodeCount - The number of nodes in the graph.
      translateX - The translation of the graph in the x-direction.
      translateY - The translation of the graph in the y-direction.
      scale - The scaling factor of the graph.

    • clearHighlight

      public void clearHighlight()
      Clears all highlighted nodes.

    • getAdjacencyMatrix

      public int[][] getAdjacencyMatrix()
      Returns the adjacency matrix representing the graph.
      Returns:
      The adjacency matrix of the graph.
